title: Ornaments for the words "of" and "the"
content: Does anyone know an ornament typeface that has characters for the words "of" and "the"? I'm looking for an 1800s feel. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
author: talgoretsky

comments.content:
[Brothers Word Logos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/brothers/word-logos/) has a bunch of that kind of stuff, and [Bello Words Body](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/underware/bello/words-body/) and [Bello Words Solo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/underware/bello/words-solo/) are nice fat swashy script alternatives.

- Lex
Thanks, Lex. Brothers is really cool.

My Taroca font has some of those kinds of ornaments:  
 [http://www.bvfonts.com/fonts/details.php?id=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.bvfonts.com/fonts/details.php?id=48 "http://www.bvfonts.com/fonts/details.php?id=48")  
;)  
Jess Latham  
 [www.bvfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.bvfonts.com/ "www.bvfonts.com")
Adobe Woodtype Ornaments has some, as does Waters Titling.

For the sign painter's touch: Jim Parkinson's [FF Catch Words One](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_catch_words_one/?acs=1) and  
 [FF Catch Words Two](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014213757/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_catch_words_two/?acs=1) in various languages.
